forms Module¶

class myway.apps.account.forms.RegistrationForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.util.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=':', empty_permitted=False, instance=None)¶

Bases: django.forms.models.ModelForm

Form for registering a new user account

class Meta¶
model¶

alias of User

RegistrationForm.clean_password2()¶

Verify password2 is the same as password1

RegistrationForm.clean_username()¶

Verify username not existed in database

RegistrationForm.media¶
RegistrationForm.save(commit=True)¶

Save User and related UserProfile object into database

NOTICE: saved user has is_active set as False by default. A user account will be activated only if the user clicks confirmation link sent to his/her mailbox.

myway.apps.account.forms.validate_username_not_exist(value)¶

models Module¶

tests Module¶

This file demonstrates two different styles of tests (one doctest and one unittest). These will both pass when you run “manage.py test”.

Replace these with more appropriate tests for your application.

class myway.apps.account.tests.SimpleTest(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: django.test.testcases.TestCase

test_basic_addition()¶

Tests that 1 + 1 always equals 2.

urls Module¶

views Module¶

myway.apps.account.views.confirm(*args, **kwargs)¶

takes in a hash and activate corresponding user

myway.apps.account.views.register(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

present a registration form, once completed by user, the system will send email containing confirmation link. The registration completes only if the user confirms the link.
